books.author: by Brent Schlender and Rick Tetzeli
books.description: How Jobs, who started out as a brash young genius, developed a more mature management style.
books.name: BECOMING STEVE JOBS

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: The last voyage of the Lusitania, by the author of “The Devil in the White City.”
books.name: DEAD WAKE

books.author: by Chris Kyle with Scott McEwen and Jim DeFelice
books.description: A former member of the Navy SEALs discusses his battlefield experiences during the Iraq war. Kyle was shot to death in Texas in 2013.
books.name: AMERICAN SNIPER

books.author: by Daniel James Brown
books.description: The University of Washington’s eight-oar crew and their quest for gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.
books.name: THE BOYS IN THE BOAT

books.author: by Laura Hillenbrand
books.description: An Olympic runner’s story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II; now a movie.
books.name: UNBROKEN

books.author: by Cheryl Strayed
books.description: A woman’s account of a life-changing 1,100-mile hike along the Pacific Crest Trail during the summer of 1995; now a movie.
books.name: WILD

books.author: by Steven D. Levitt and Stephen J. Dubner
books.description: How to solve problems creatively, from the authors of “Freakonomics.”
books.name: THINK LIKE A FREAK

books.author: by Alison Weir
books.description: A history of the king’s serial marriages, from Catherine of Aragon to Catherine Parr; first published in 1991.
books.name: THE SIX WIVES OF HENRY VIII

books.author: by Atul Gawande
books.description: The surgeon and New Yorker writer considers how doctors fail patients at the end of life, and how they can do better.
books.name: BEING MORTAL

books.author: by Laura Ingalls Wilder
books.description: The writer’s autobiography, the source of her Little House on the Prairie books, completed in 1930 and never published, is annotated by a biographer.
books.name: PIONEER GIRL

books.author: by Helen Macdonald
books.description: Overwhelmed by her father’s death, a British woman decides to raise a goshawk, a bird that is fierce and notoriously difficult to tame.
books.name: H IS FOR HAWK

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The host of “The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the strange death of Gen. George S. Patton in December 1945.
books.name: KILLING PATTON

books.author: by Ayaan Hirsi Ali
books.description: The author of “Infidel” and “Nomad” argues that fundamental doctrines of Islam must change for it to be compatible with democracy.
books.name: HERETIC

books.author: by Amy Poehler
books.description: A humorous miscellany from the comedian and actress.
books.name: YES PLEASE

books.author: by Dan Ariely
books.description: The unexpected benefits of defying logic at work and at home.
books.name: THE UPSIDE OF IRRATIONALITY
